intro: Cryptantha candelabrum, commonly known as the candlestick cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, candle-like arrangement of flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. It produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cryptantha candelabrum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
